data.text: Wisdom shall praise herself,
In the congregation of the most High shall she open her mouth,
I came out of the mouth of the most High,
I dwelt in high places,
I alone compassed the circuit of heaven,
In the waves of the sea, and in all the earth,
With all these I sought rest:
So the Creator of all things gave me a commandment,
He created me from the beginning before the world,
In the holy tabernacle I served before him;
Likewise in the beloved city he gave me rest,
And I took root in an honorable people,
I was exalted like a cedar in Lebanon,
I was exalted like a palm tree on the sea shore,
I gave a sweet smell like cinnamon and aspalathus,
As the turpentine tree I stretched out my branches,
As the vine brought I forth pleasant savor,
Come unto me, all ye that be desirous of me,
For my memorial is sweeter than honey,
They that eat me shall yet be hungry,
He that obeyeth me shall never be confounded,
All these things are the book of the covenant of the most high God,
He filleth all things with his wisdom,
He maketh the understanding to abound like Euphrates,
He maketh the doctrine of knowledge appear as the light,
The first man knew her not perfectly:
For her thoughts are more than the sea,
I also came out as a brook from a river,
I said, I will water my best garden,
I will yet make doctrine to shine as the morning,
I will yet pour out doctrine as prophecy,
Behold that I have not labored for myself only,
